attributes.action: Agree the terms of an Order in Council under Section 30 of the Scotland Act 1998
attributes.additional_details:
In May 2021, the Scottish Government was re-elected on a clear promise to give the people of Scotland the choice of independence. The election returned a Scottish Parliament with a decisive majority in favour of independence and with a mandate for an independence referendum.

It is unacceptable for the people of Scotland to be blocked from making that choice given the clear majority for a referendum in the Scottish Parliament.

The UK Government must agree to negotiate the terms of a section 30 order.
attributes.background: The First Minister of Scotland wrote to the UK Prime Minister on 28 June 2022 seeking to negotiate the terms of a section 30 order to allow a second independence referendum to take place. The UK Government should agree to a transfer of power from the UK Parliament to the Scottish Parliament for this

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610295
